item.description:
This time we're going to the other end of JP, to a fine Irish establishment - "James's Gate".
James' Gate consists of a Restaurant and a Pub - we'll be going to the Pub (which boasts a wonderful fireplace - great for chilly evenings).
We will meet in the Pub at 7pm.

James' Gate recently celebrated their 10 year anniversary, and have cracked the nod in several local Restaurant Awards, including "Best of Boston 2005". In addition to their wonderful food, awesome draft beer selection and interestingly international wine list, they also display works of local artists, including a variety of media and photography.

For additional information, directions and photographs, see James's Gate Restaurant & Pub

Note: For those folks using public transport, the No. 39 bus goes right thru the center of JP, down S. Huntington Ave and Center Street. James' Gate is just off South Street, approx. 4 blocks south of where South Street forks left off Center Street. Any additional questions re: directions, please call James' Gate directly.
item.name: JP Pub Crawl #2
